characters: GOD DAMN IT ZOE, DON'T MOVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not exactly sure where we are. And we're not exactl sure who's talking. All we know is that we are looking at foot. One bare foot with chipped red polish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I didn't get a pedicure for this. How embarrassing. Look at that... The toes open and then curl down as if trying to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with me? If I were with a real guy doing this, I would've gotten a pedicure. And a wax. I'm pathetic. The CAMERA PANS to the other foot, which is also chipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, that one's even worse. And when did my toes get so fat? No wonder I'm alone. I'm a fat-toed animal. Zoe lets out a sigh.    She speaks out-loud now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I didn't get a pedicure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? DR. HARRIS (mid-fifties, jovial) looks up from between Zo knees, the light on his head flashing right in Zoe's eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My toes...sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not looking at your toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   Duh. Dr. Harris stands and takes off his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? And now, for the first time, we see ZOE. Despite the pape gown and worried look on her face, she's a late-30-someth girl-next-door type. She could be your best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll elevate your legs for ten minutes and then you're good to go. He sets a kitchen timer and then pushes a button to raise legs. We hear the loud TICK TOCK of the timer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the first time I've heard that ticking clock sound and it doesn't freak me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Just relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I'm totally freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be great. I have a feeling you and... (checks empty syringe) Number CRM-101404 are going to make beautiful babies together. Zoe smiles.   Maybe he's right.   Yeah...of course he's r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number CRM-101404? Are you high?

dialogues.speaker: TITLE UP
dialogues.text: BOBBY, 39 (but says he's 33,) gay and gorgeous, opens a f and points to a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says here he has red hair and freckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And glasses, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why are we picking him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's ugly. Zoe points to a stack of potential donors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they're all telling the truth? If they're so smart and good looking, why are they beating off into a cup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever fucked a guy with red hair and freckles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, and I won't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about your kid? No one's going to want to fuck your kid. (beat) That came out wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...it's a good thing you're not going to be the father.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE UP
dialogues.text: Bobby spits out a mouthful of Sauvignon Blanc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    I can't be the father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we don't have to have sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, I didn't even think about that. Rewind, rewind, rewind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one of my best friends. Don't you want to help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but...that's too much. I'll walk your dog, tell you when you look fat, be honest about your eyebrows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few sperm. Big deal. You waste billions of them every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I flee at the slightest chance of intimacy. Do you see these bags under my eyes? Ricardo slept over last night, and he wanted to hold me. I actually had to fake a seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.     Forget the whole thing. Zoe sighs and puts her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the whole thing.    It's just a phase...

dialogues.speaker: TITLE UP
dialogues.text: Zoe and MONA, Zoe's age but looks much older, sit at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want kids.    Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy for you to say.    You have four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and it's awful. Three CHILDREN run through the kitchen yelling and scream A beat later, a TODDLER runs after them crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've ruined my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my vagina? Zoe shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to? Zoe shakes her head again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would do that for you. To prove to you that you don't want to have kids, I will show you my vagina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see your vagina.    I want a baby. My own baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible you're just a little lonely? You know, you haven't met the right guy and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about a guy. I don't need a guy. I don't even think I want a guy at this point. I've dated a hundred guys in the last five years, and not one of them is even close to being the one. How long am I supposed to wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know. He could be right around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then he's late. And I hate people who are late. And what if he's not right around the corner? What if he's miles away? Zoe shakes her head.   She becomes very serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to have a baby. And time is running out. I hear a clock ticking every time I close my eyes. I need it to stop. We hear a loud DING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe opens her eyes. We're back in the exam room.      She at the timer, which just hit zero. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ding. Then a tear forms in the corner of her eye. She wipes it away. She wipes a tear from the other eye. Happy tears. Then she looks at her legs high above her on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck am I supposed to get down from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe walks down the hall with her legs pressed firmly together, moving only from the knees down. Dr. Harris passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to walk like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Okay. Zoe separates her legs an inch.     And then closes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we hug? We might have just made a baby together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe walks through the waiting room with her legs still pressed together. She sees two PREGNANT WOMAN, touches he own stomach and smiles. She finally feels part of this exclusive baby club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe enters the elevator where there is a WOMAN holding a BABY. Zoe smiles at them. Another member of the club...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. The elevator descends. Zoe continues to stare at the baby with a big smile. She stares for an uncomfortably long ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're starting to freak me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Zoe looks down.    After a beat, she sneaks another look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's POURING outside. The kind of rain that turns umbrell inside out. NEW YORKERS run for cover with newspapers ove their heads. Despite the rain, Zoe skips out of the building with her hands in the air and twirls around. Realizing that she's spread her legs too far apart, she snaps them back togeth A WOMAN pushing a baby stroller covered in plastic runs b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! Zoe looks uptown for a cab. Nope. Nothing. She starts to walk, still keeping her legs firmly pressed together. She rounds the corner towards the subway station and then, miraculously, spies a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi! She runs (little steps) across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallelujah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as the word comes out of her mouth, she notices someone entering the cab from the other side. This is STAN, early 40s, but looks more like a college ki faded jeans, t-shirt, cute, messy hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...excuse me. This is my cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You own it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm about to rent it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, if we're being technical, you kind of stole it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you see someone about to get in a cab, you can't just run in from the other side and say it's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cabbie) Sir, who saw you first? The CABBIE picks up his paper and starts to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're not from around here, but there's a code. It's like war, even though it's brutal and bloody, there are still certain rules we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.   Forget it.   I'll get out. Zoe grabs the door handle and then turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not because you're right, but because I am in a terrific mood, and you are ruining it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I'll get out. They each get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Stan stand on opposite sides of the taxi in the POURING RAIN. Zoe crosses her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You tell me. That question is answered by the cabbie, who now peels ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Where's he going?! (waving her hands, then) Come back! They both stand there with a taxi's width between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was stupid. Why'd you get out, you, stupid-head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you were in a great mood and I was ruining it. I felt bad. (then) Did you just call me stupid-head? Zoe storms off with her little steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and Zoe each swipe their Metrocards at the same time They enter the subway platform which is jam packed with a the other NEW YORKERS who are shit-out-of-luck in the cab department. Rain droplets drip from the ceiling above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your great mood now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed subway car. Zoe and Stan are back-to-back, pushe together by the crowd. Zoe tries to read her paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop talking to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Stan walk up the stairs a few feet apart from eac other. Zoe does her best to ignore the obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why are you in such a good mood anyway? They reach the top of the stairs. The rain has stopped, a the sun is just starting to peek through. Everything is w and has a magical quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that it's any of your business, but...good things are happening to me. Stan is moved by this.   What a thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. I hope it continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Well, have a nice life. Try not to steal any more cabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do the same. They nod and separate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudson Pets is a small but quaint West Village pet store filled with dogs, cats and a few rabbits. Zoe enters. Her dog, NUTS, a raggedy, pug-like dog with h legs in a WHEELCHAIR, bounds/wheels towards her, barking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nutsy. How's it going? She gives Nuts a good scratch. JALISA, mid-30s, Latina hottie, and Bobby run from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, you're glowing. (to Jalisa) She's glowing, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glowing.   Tell us everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not much to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got shot up with a wad of red-headed-freckle sperm. There's something to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had red hair and freckles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to talk her out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do that, Mami?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jalisa) I know, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red pubes.     Eek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm never going to see his pubes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see your kid's pubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you'll know they're there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what happened?    Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lay down, put my feet up, five minutes later it was over. I barely felt a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like Ricardo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it, Papi. Bobby and Jalisa high five.    Bobby then turns to Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...what happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, we wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no fun, I want to know if I'm going to be a fairy godmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll just have to wait and see. Zoe smiles and heads for the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights in the pet store go dark.   Moments later, Zoe Bobby, Jalisa and Nuts exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Zoe, one drink. You can have an O'Dhouls or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go to the piano bar and get Bobby to sing some Ace of Base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, she's not coming. I can tell by the dull look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all hug.   Bobby and Jalisa walk away arm-in-arm, singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the sign and it opened up my eyes, I saw the sign... Zoe turns to lock up.   While her back is turned, Stan ap from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aahhh! Zoe screams and drops the keys. Nuts, overexcited by Zoe' reaction, starts to run/wheel in circles and then tips ov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared the hell out of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow.   Is he...okay? Nuts is still on the ground, his wheels spinning.   Zoe s him upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to scare you. Or hurt your dog. Don't worry, I'm not a stalker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know I worked here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed you after the subway. (thinks, then) That sounds a little stalkery, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just really wanted to see you again. Almost like I had to see you again. Can I walk you home? (then) Is it me or does everything I say make me sound more like a stalker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe allows a small smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I just give you my card? Here. Take my card. I'm not a freak. Really. I sell cheese. This hangs out there for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. My family has a goat farm. We make cheese. You like cheese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. I've never really thought about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Goat. Maybe you've seen us at the Farmer's market? Come by sometime and you can taste my cheese. (then) Okay, I'm going to go. This has not gone as planned. Stan smiles meekly and then turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. Stan lifts his hand to wave but doesn't even turn around. Clearly, he feels like an idiot. Zoe watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of a cute brownstone with window boxes a front stoop. We TILT UP to the third floor window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is asleep with the morning sun on her face. Nuts is beside her, his two little, lame legs hanging off the pil Zoe opens her eyes. After a beat, she gets up and walks to the mirror. She li up her pajama top and looks at her stomach, sticking it o as far as it will go. It's flat as a board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven WOMEN sit around the cramped living room of this sm East Village apartment. At least one woman is nursing a child that looks entirely too old to still be nursing. This is the SINGLE MOTHERS BY CHOICE Support Group. CAROL 40's, short hair, tank top and no bra, is the leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone, please say hello to Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Single Mother's By Choice. As the name suggests, we are all single mothers by choice. Some of us have adopted, some conceived with a donor, every story is different, but with the same common denominator. We wanted to have a child, and we didn't need a partner to make it happen. The women smile and nod. They are a proud, no-nonsense, somewhat masculine bunch. LORI, pregnant with a buzz cut, turns to Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a doer or a tryer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you already a single mother or are you trying to become one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I guess I'm trying. I was just inseminated a few days ago. (then) Inseminated...makes me feel like a cow or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when we don't have partners with penises, we do what we've got to do, right? (then) So, tell us a little bit about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's see...um, I own a pet store on Hudson Street. Dogs, cats, rabbits...no birds, they creep me out. Before that, I worked for Google, which I completely hated. One day, I decided life was too short, and, against my accountant's advice, I quit Google, cashed out and bought the pet store. Now I'm really happy on the work front, but I still haven't found, you know, the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes.   The elusive "one."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always imagined I'd be married with kids by now, but it doesn't look like it's going to happen that way. So, time for Plan B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Society tells us we're supposed to find that special person to make us happy and complete. But guess what...you have to create your own happiness. You don't need someone to complete you, some...man. You already are complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen, sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to have a baby, we here at Single Mothers By Choice can be your partners. We will be your emotional rocks. Zoe looks around at her new "partners." There's SARA, the one nursing the toddler. And TABITHA, a tall women with a even taller afro and a nose ring. BRIDGET, a young girl covered in tatoos. And several more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inception to college graduation and everything in between. We're here for each other. Sara smiles and nods at her nursing child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dakota was actually born right here in this very room. Right where you're sitting, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Really? Right here?      Imagine that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best day of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how old is she now? Dakota looks up from the breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Mona are sitting by the window sharing a plate of pastries and a pot of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you join a support group of unattractive, militant lesbians when you have me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're really not that supportive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just told me that if I breast- feed "my girls" will end up looking like empty tube socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just being honest. And don't even get me started on what childbirth does to your bladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it do to your bladder? Mona cracks up and then stops abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just peed a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I'm pregnant. The doctor says it will probably take several tries. Something about frozen sperm being lazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   Take your time. Zoe takes a sip of coffee and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, should I call this guy?   Do you think that would be weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I think it's weird that you're pursuing someone at the exact moment in time that you might be most unavailable? No. Because that's what you do. You sabotage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring her) He works at the Farmer's market. And it's right around the corner. Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look fat and old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go spy on him. Come on. It will be fun. Like high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. (checks watch) This twenty minute breakfast concludes my "me" time for the week. More proof that you should not have kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Farmer's Market is crowded with people. We hear the sounds of a bluegrass band playing somewhere nearby. Zoe spies the LITTLE GOAT sign. But Stan is not there. looks around the neighboring stalls for him, but no luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well. She walks towards 14th street. We see the bluegrass band the steps by the subway station. It's not a big band, jus few guys with an open banjo case and a sign that reads, " Organics." The country twang of the music is in sharp contrast with the tall buildings all around. As she gets closer, she notices that Stan is in the band. He's playing banjo. Zoe quickly ducks into the nearest food stall, OLIVIA'S BERRIES. OLIVIA, mid-twenties, natural beauty, approaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) No, I'm fine. Zoe watches Stan. She mindlessly starts eating some blueberries out of the display pint. Olivia sees that Zoe looking at Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tasty, huh? Zoe nods and takes another berry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All ripe and juicy. And firm, too. Bet you could just eat him up in one bite, right? Zoe now turns, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't look now, but he's coming this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia winks and moves off. Zoe turns back and is now fac to-face with Stan, who's smiling from ear-to-ear, his ban slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-ha! I didn't scare you away after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be casual) I was just in the neighborhood. I thought I'd come by and get some blueberries. I'm going to make a pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love blueberry pie. Stan takes two pints of blueberries and hands them to Zoe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused. I thought you made cheese or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think I don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, you're over there playing the banjo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't someone do both?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, I didn't know anyone did either. Olivia returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to introduce me to your new friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. (to Zoe) Come on. Let me show you around. Stan puts his arm around Zoe and leads her away.   Olivia watches them go with her arms crossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan walks Zoe through his cheese stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our basic chevre, probably our best seller. The cheese that started it all, as they say. Then over here we have our surface- ripened cheeses. These are the aged/raw milk cheeses. (realizing) This is really boring, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like you're in a foreign country and the only thing to watch on tv is a documentary on cheese. You don't want to watch it, but somehow you can't stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I think it's interesting.    Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you asked for it... (boring voice) The aged/raw milk cheeses are made from raw milk and then aged for four to six months. Sometimes more. Sometimes less. Usually more. Depends on the cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.   You're killing me. FRED, early twenties, white guy with Rasta-type dreads, l up from behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, Zoe, Zoe, Fred. (then) She's the one I followed from the subway the other day like a total psychopath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...I heard about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know whether to be flattered or terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't scare her away.   I'm trying to redeem myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you should put down the banjo. You look like a doofus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doofus? (then, to Zoe) Do you think I look like a doofus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know what a doofus looks like. Fred points to Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. If I put the banjo down, can I take you to lunch or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should really get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, say the word and we can have a six-course tasting menu at Union Square Cafe. I know the chef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds nice, but, I should probably go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can I call you? Zoe smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe enters the pet store with two big bags of vegetables. soon as she steps foot in the store, Bobby and Jalisa acc her.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Okay, spill it.

dialogues.speaker: JALISA
dialogues.text: Who is he? What does he do?    How do we know him?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JALISA
dialogues.text: Stan from the Farmer's Market? He's called twice already.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Is he a farmer? Because that's not okay.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: No.   He makes cheese.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He's a pilgrim?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: I don't know what he is. He's cute and different and plays the banjo. (then) I think I like him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What about the, you know, bun in the oven?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: I really doubt I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: JALISA
dialogues.text: You want to be pregnant. You don't want to be pregnant. I'm confused.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: I want to be pregnant. Of course I want to be pregnant. I mean, I put a lot of thought into this, right? (then) So what did Stan say?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: He says to name any restaurant you want to go to. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be there with bells on. (then) He didn't say the "bells on" part. I added that. Sounds a little too gay, though, so I take it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe walks down 8th street. This is the first time we've s her really pulled together, and she looks hot. She turns into the restaurant she's chosen for the big date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Stan stand at the counter with an array of hot do in front of them. Stan looks at the hot dogs skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have gone anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take a bite.   You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Per Se, Jean Georges, Nobu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gray's Papaya.   Cheers. She clinks his dog and then they each take a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, right? Stan nods, covering his mouth because the bite is so big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've lived here your whole life and never been to Gray's Papaya. What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually haven't lived here my whole life. We moved out of the city when my parents bought the farm....not died, but actually bought a farm and moved upstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must have been a nice place to grow up. On a farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just me and my grandmother. She lives in a retirement community in Queens. (an awkward beat) My parents died when I was young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. There is a long silence.   They both stare at the hot dog

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say now.    I've made it all awkward and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. (then) My dad was kind of a bad guy, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.   I'm so sorry, Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, come on, we'll get all this stuff out of the way so we never have to talk about it again. Let's ask all the awkward, get-to-know- you questions right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see...are you religious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.   What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you sick of going to weddings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I have to listen to one more couple write their own vows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate when they write their own vows! They clasp hands. Not in a high-fivey way, but in a connected, we have so much in common way. Their hands sta together, feeling the charge between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about kids? Zoe feels the blood rush to her cheeks.   Like everyone t must now be looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do you want them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I want kids. She pulls her hand away. This has all gotten suddenly rea She looks at Stan, almost afraid to ask the next question

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Absolutely. Zoe nods.   Slowly, she starts to breathe again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now walking home together, arm-in-arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, first kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jen Salzer. Seventh grade. She wore a head-gear. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer camp. I think his name was-- Stan interrupts by kissing her. And it's a great kiss. Fu of promises and answers. They linger there for a moment..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was way better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can I see you again? Zoe feels her heart jump.    She kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is lying in bed with Nuts on the pillow next to her. sun is shining and they are both waking up. She gets up and goes to the mirror. She lifts up her nightgown and looks at her stomach, this time with a slig look of concern on her face.

dialogues.speaker: INT. EQUINOX
dialogues.text: Zoe and Mona are side-by-side on the elliptical machines. Zoe is going very fast, while Mona is barely moving at al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I'm pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll get fat and hormonal and I'll say, "I told you so."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if this could go somewhere with Stan? Like, really go somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it will work out perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because just when you really like him, you'll break up because you're pregnant and then you never have to put yourself out there and possibly get hurt. That's your dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks, then) I'm not pregnant. She gets off the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in a foggy steam room with Zoe, Mona and a few oth WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, when are you seeing him again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't have sex with him. That's the last thing we need. You get knocked up and we'll have no idea who the father is. A few women look over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we'll have to do a paternity test. Is it the cheese farmer or the red-pubed bandit? More women look over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to have sex with him tonight. It's too soon. (for the women's benefit) I'm not a slut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, bring condoms, just in case. (thinks, then) And a pregnancy test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not joking. All of the women are now staring at Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really not a slut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe sits on the bed, holding a pregnancy test in her hand Nuts is beside her. He looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe pees on the stick.   Nuts is beside her, watching wit head tilted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop looking at me like that.   I'm not pregnant. Zoe finishes peeing and looks at the test.   Nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, come on... We hear the doorbell RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Zoe looks down at the test. Still nothing.      We wait a watch the test. The doorbell RINGS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! A faint PLUS SIGN is forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shitshitshitshit... The plus sign then turns BRIGHT PINK. Zoe's heart stops. There it is. Plain as day. Pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, shit. Zoe stands.   Looks at herself in the mirror.   And then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fucking shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manhattan fades into the distance, as they drive over the Brooklyn Bridge. Zoe cracks the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you feeling okay? Zoe nods.   Her face looks pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, because this should really be a culinary adventure. This is an underground restaurant that moves from apartment to apartment, depending on the chef. Zoe nods again. Hasn't heard a word he's said. She rolls the window all the way down and hangs her head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And some of the guys from the band will be there. So, we might get a little jam going. Sounds fun, right? (then) Zoe? Zoe's POV. Headlights from passing cars whiz by, and the wind swirls her hair into her face. Brooklyn approaches l a bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan walks down a long table filled with appetizers. He i making a plate for each of them. Zoe trails behind, beads sweat on her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this looks like a mache salad with grapes and feta. He takes some for each of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this, oh this must be white beans and lamb's tongue. You've got to have some of this. Etienne is famous for his lamb's tongue. Olivia approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Olivia.   You remember Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. How'd that blueberry pie turn out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bought blueberries from me? Said you were going to make a pie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, can you excuse me for a second? Zoe hurries off.   Olivia watches her go.   Eyes narrowin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way she knows how to bake a pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe hovers by the window, whispering into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!   Where are you? I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that? Zoe hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is now on the phone with Mona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't panic. Could be a false positive. Take another test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm at some underground foodie party in Brooklyn. Where am I gonna-- Out the window and across the street, we see a drugstore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe runs down the aisle and empties one, two, three...wha the fuck, every pregnancy test into her basket. Her cell phone RINGS.    It's Bobby.   She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm looking at a subway map. Which way is Brooklyn? She hangs up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe hurries through the living room, a packed drugstore b hidden under her arm. Stan comes up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been? Zoe jumps and accidentally drops the bag. The tests spill out onto the floor. She quickly scoops everything back in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.   You scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just go to the store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I had a little emergency. I have a, a, um...corn, and I needed to get those little...corn pads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corn pads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's gross. Do you know where the bathroom is? Zoe walks off leaving him to ponder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a corn pad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe pees on eight sticks at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corn pad?    What the hell is wrong with you? Someone KNOCKS on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corn pad.    Jesus Christ. The knocking turns to an angry BANGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax! I'll be out in... (checks box) Three to five minutes. Zoe holds up the tests. One by one, the little windows al show PLUS SIGNS and CHECK MARKS and DOUBLE HASH MARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe exits the bathroom with a wide-eyed, terrified look o her face. By the bar, she sees a PREGNANT WOMAN sipping a glass of wine. She rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, are you allowed to drink when you're... Zoe makes hand motions at her belly, but can't say the wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... More hand gestures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pregnant? (off Zoe's nod) My doctor says one glass is-- Zoe doesn't wait for her to finish. She rushes the bar, pours a glass of wine and downs it like a frat boy funnel a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, we hear a banjo and guitar tuning up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, JERRY and SCOOTER are just starting to play. A smal crowd gathers round. Stan starts to sing an old tune call "Sweet Little Miss Blue Eyes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who makes me forget all the other girls I met, sweet, little Miss Blue Eyes. Who's sweeter to me, than she really ought to be, sweet little Miss Blue Eyes. Zoe appears at the door to the patio.   Stan smiles at he while he sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's gonna start takin' care of my heart, she makes me realize. And it's lucky for me and I really want to be with... (winks at Zoe) sweet, little Miss-- Stan's POV as Zoe covers her mouth with two hands and bol for the bathroom, puking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe's head is in the toilet. Just when we think she's don she pukes again. Finally, she lifts her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhhhhhh. She spies an unused pregnancy test on the floor.  One tha must have dropped. Maybe this will be the one with the answer she's looking for. She sits back on the toilet, mustering up all of her focus to pee again. She closes he eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, God... But she can't pee.   She tries and tries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water, water everywhere, but not a drop to... She doubles over and pukes between her knees.   When she' done, she holds up the test. CU of the stick, which has no pee on it but is covered in vomit. Slowly the test reveals a PLUS SIGN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and Zoe walk towards Zoe's brownstone. Stan is practically holding her up. Zoe stumbles along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My singing made you vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    It's not that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, we were a little out of tune, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't feel well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it your corns?    Hurts to walk? ANGLE on Carol, from Single Mother's By Choice, approachi Zoe's face pales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   Hi.    Hey, there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been?    You haven't been coming to any--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) Right. I know. I've been so busy. Next one, I'm there. For sure. (then, awkward) This is my friend, Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing Stan suspiciously) Hello. Are you two--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late. Yes. We are. We really are. (pushing Stan along) I'll see you at the meeting. Bye. They walk on.   Stan looks at Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old...boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name is Carol. We're on a...committee together. They reach Zoe's front stoop.   Zoe peers over Stan's sho to make sure Carol's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I have to go to bed now. I'll call you, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (then) Hey, I was thinking, if you don't have any plans this weekend, maybe you'd like to come up to the farm and get away for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you tomorrow. Something's not agreeing with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it the lamb's tongue? Zoe runs inside holding her hand over her mouth.   Stan s there for a beat. He calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well...this weekend.   Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe lies in bed. Nuts sleeps beside her. Zoe stares out t window at a flickering street lamp, her face full of fear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell have I done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of a retirement compound in Queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is well-appointed and cheery. A young STAFF wor behind a front desk area. Were it not for a scattering of PEOPLE IN WHEELCHAIRS, you might think we were at a Ramad Zoe walks by the front desk.   ANNIE, an employee, looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Zoe.   You look fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how that's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's different. Did you get highlights or a spray tan? Your face looks like it's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't say glowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!   Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a small group of WOMEN speed walking around the courtyard. They are fully decked out in jogging suits, visors and nose shields. The ringleader is NANA, 83, fit fabulous. On the sidelines is ARTHUR, 87, with his walker and big g as he watches the ladies exercise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my dear! He struggles to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, don't get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, because I can't get up. Came to see my lovely fiance? She's looking fine today, let me tell you. Fine. Nana rounds the bend and waves enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Nana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more mile to go. Do you have a minute? Talk to Arthur. Zoe looks at Arthur who's now watching Nana's ass, noddin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talking about. Work it. Horrified, Zoe quickly runs after Nana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is now speed walking with the ladies. She mimics the same strong arm movements and heel-toe foot action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want a nose guard?   I have an extra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Ethel Silverbeck just had another carcinoma removed from her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nana) I kind of need to talk to you. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nana gives her friends a nod, and they fall back several paces. Zoe waits for them to be out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, they can't hear anything anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't hear her) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear you, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Judy, she's pregnant.   Turn your hearing aide up. Zoe closes her eyes.    Nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nana hands Zoe a cup of tea.   Zoe's eyes well with tears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused. Isn't this what you wanted? You bought sperm and were inseminated by your doctor. This isn't what we would call an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now it's all happening so fast. Did I really think this through?

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: We talked about it for months. You said it was what you wanted more than anything in the world.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: But this guy, he's...special.   It's all going to fall apart now.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: What makes him so special?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: I don't know. He's very...real. And funny. And different. The other guys I've been with all had their briefcases and their five- year plans and their secretaries they were fucking. Stan doesn't have a five-year plan. I don't even know if he has a plan.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: What about a secretary?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Some kid named Fred. (then) I like him, Nana.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: Well, if he's the right one, he'll stay.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Do you really think so?

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: Gosh, I don't know. I hoped that would be enough to appease you.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Should I still visit him for the weekend? Or should I just vanish and hope he forgets I ever existed.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. Go up there for the weekend. Spend some time with him and see what he's really like.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Yeah.   You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might find out he's a total douchebag and then the whole thing is moot. Zoe looks at Nana.   Douchebag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is in the car. We are CLOSE on her as she talks rapid and a bit maniacally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so we'll just hope that he's a douchebag. Could happen, right? WIDEN to reveal Nuts in the passenger seat.      He's yaw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     Am I keeping you up? Nuts closes his eyes and lays down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My whole life is falling apart and you can't keep your bug-eyes open? (yawning) Thanks. Now I'm yawning. But why am I so tired? I slept nine hours. (thinks, then) And I'm starving, too. What the hell is going on? Zoe sees a gas station and jams on the breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe pours a massive cup of coffee. One of those gas stati Big Gulp cups. Even the TRUCKER next to her chooses a smaller cup. Then, a look crosses her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I even allowed to drink coffee? The trucker looks at her.    She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know anything about being pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe's car is now parked on the side of a highway in the middle of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is sound asleep with her head back and her mouth open small, empty coffee cup in her hand, crumpled candy bar wrappers on the floor, and an almost empty bag of Cheetos in her lap. Her cell phone RINGS. Zoe doesn't move. After the third ring, she lifts her head and looks around. It takes her a few moments to realize what's happened. She looks at the little coffee cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, decaf. She picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you? Zoe looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe bumps along the winding driveway of this idyllic Huds River farm. There are red barns in the distance and green pastures filled with goats and sheep. The house is an old carriage house with a rusty weather-vane on top. Zoe parks the car and takes in the whole scene. Stan open the front door, with a huge smile on his face. Zoe sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so not a douchebag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the front door.    Zoe takes in the charming carriage house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you live here. This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just come on weekends. My parents really live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Where are they now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen. Zoe stops short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, they're here? Now? Is this a "meet the parents" kind of thing? I wasn't prepared for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not at all.    I mean, you'll meet them, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you said come up for the weekend, I assumed it was just us. (then) I think I need to lay down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe lies in the small bed with the covers pulled up to he chin. Stan stands above her with an odd look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hung-over or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just...not myself. Give me ten minutes. A ten-minute power nap and I'm good. I need to regroup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're okay? (then) Zoe? Hello? But she's already out.   Stan gives her a little poke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan enters the kitchen. His parents, JOAN and EDWARD loo up expectantly, as if about to meet their new daughter-in law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   It's just you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's taking a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nap?   Now? She just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I need you to not be judgemental, okay. I like this girl a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I be judgemental?    We haven't even met her yet. We hear a SQUEAK, SQUEAK, SQUEAK coming down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the heck is that? The SQUEAKING continues and then all eyes turn as Nuts ro into the kitchen and stops. He tilts his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   This is Nuts. Joan and Edward take in the raggedy/wheelchair-bound dog then look at Stan. Stan shoots his mom a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's judging?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now dark. Zoe is asleep in the exact same position. Suddenly, we hear a loud GRUMBLE. Her eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? We hear the GRUMBLE again.    It's her stomach.   She put hands over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Zoe gets out of bed and goes right for the Cheetos. The b is empty. She smears her hand on the inside of the bag an then licks the orange cheese from her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe peeks out of the bedroom and looks both ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Stan? No one in sight.   She waits a beat and then whispers lou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe peers her head into the empty kitchen.   Nuts is with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan?    Hello? Zoe stands there unsure of what to do next. Then we hear stomach GROWL again. Her eyes turn to the stove. Somethin smells out of this world. She tiptoes over and opens the pot. It's beef stew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. She makes sure the coast is clear and then looks for a sp She can't find one. She spies a loaf of white bread. Grab a piece, folds it and then scoops up a heaping bite of st and devours it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Oh, my God. She replaces the lid on the pot. And now she just stands there. And stands there some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, who am I kidding? She quickly takes two slices of bread and goes back in. T time, she uses one piece of bread as a ladle and then the other to turn it into a sandwich. She takes a huge bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   My.    God. Stew dribbles down her chin. She takes a third piece of bread to wipe her face and then takes a bite of that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuts starts to whine and beg. Zoe uses her bread-ladle to toss some stew on the floor for him. It lands with plop. And now Joan enters. Zoe and Nuts turn, their mouths bursting. Joan doesn't quite know what to do. All she kno is she's supposed to be open-minded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a plate? Zoe shakes her head no.     Wow.   This is embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A napkin? Zoe nods her head. Joan gives her one. Zoe holds it over her mouth as she tries in vain to swallow this inhuman bi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Joan. Zoe nods.   Still can't swallow the bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you must be Zoe. Zoe nods again. She tries to shake Joan's hand. It's the best she can do. Unfortunately, her fingers are fluoresce orange from the Cheetos powder. Joan pulls her hand back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dining room is warm and lovely. There's faded wallpap and an old stagecoach lamp serving as a chandelier. Despi the inviting room, Zoe looks very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stew is delicious, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mom, it's awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zoe) Have you ever in your life had stew like this? Come on, be honest. Zoe looks at Joan.      Joan smiles.    It will be their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...no.    Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are having coffee and dessert in the living room. Things seem more comfortable now. Zoe actually looks like she might be enjoying herself. Nuts sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are all the animals in your pet store...differently abled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you can say paralyzed. He doesn't mind. (then) No, our pets are all in great shape. Purebreads mostly, but not from puppy mills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those puppy mills are terrible.    I read about them in the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's actually how I ended up with Nuts. I bought him from this pet store near my house. Six months later, I had thousands of dollars in vet bills and had to put him in a wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have sued that place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought about it, but what was that really going to do? They were still going to sell inbred dogs. So...I took the money I made when I left Google and just bought the place figuring I would do better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worked for Google? Zoe nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I not know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you made a lot of money and then bought a pet store? Stan puts his arm around her and gives her a squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been fun. Beats brand management, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Edward) That sounds like us, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. (to Zoe) When we bought this farm we just wanted to make cheese because we couldn't find anything we liked in the stores. And now, twenty years later, here we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes in life you just have to take matters into your own hands. Make things happen your own way, you know? Zoe forces a smile.   If only they knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon is full and fireflies dot the air as Zoe and Sta walk the grounds of the farm. Nuts trots/rolls ahead of them in a different wheelchair. This one is more rugged, with mountain-bike-type wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe that Nuts has an off-road wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got one for snow, too.      With little skis on the bottom. Stan smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you making fun of me?   Do you think I spoil him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I really think you're amazing. I mean, that story you told tonight. You just quit your whole professional life because of this little dog? Started your own business, just like that? Zoe shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very...unique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're a dime a dozen. I can't tell you how many banjo playing, cheese makers I've been with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep waiting for the other shoe to drop. Like, how can you be so perfect? Why are you even still single? I can't believe no one's snatched you up by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drive them all away, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Stan takes her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know this is all going fast...the time we're spending together, meeting my parents and everything...but, I'm okay with that. I want it to go fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is going fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But isn't that okay? Aren't we old enough to skip all the bullshit? What are we waiting for? I...want to be with you. Zoe opens her mouth. She's got to tell him.    Before thi goes any further, she has to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. There's something I want to show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's floor to ceiling wooden shelves all filled with chee Stan ceremoniously unwraps a wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a new kind of goat's milk we're using. I've been developing the recipe, and now it needs to age. It'll be ready for market in several months. (then, excited) Want to know what it's called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You named a piece of cheese after me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just one piece. The whole line. This will forever in history be known as the Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless, of course, it tastes like shit, and then we'll just scrap it. (with a wink) But that'll never happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's going to be fantastic. Sweet and sassy and very complex. Why do you think I'm calling it Zoe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's ever named a piece of cheese after me before. Zoe stares at the cheese for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kind of hard to read right now. You're either seriously flattered or totally repulsed. Zoe smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to kiss you right now, but it really smells like cheese in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the dairy kicks open and Stan carries Zoe out Her legs are around his waist and they are making out lik crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan carries Zoe up the stairs. They are tripping and kissing and now tearing at each other's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan throws Zoe on the bed and then peels off his shirt. body looks amazing in the shadowy moonlight. Zoe lies the looking at him before he jumps on top of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) You're such a douchebag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Zoe shakes her head and then melts into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now on their backs staring at the ceiling.    Th look happy and worn out Their P.O.V. Those little glow-in-the-dark star stickers all over the ceiling. There's barely any glow left. Stan lets out a big sigh as he looks at the "stars"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was amazing. I mean, like, totally and exceptionally, over-the- top, amazing. Zoe turns to him.   Takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I really have to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I have to tell you, too. Now Stan turns to her.     They are face-to-face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go first? `Cause if we're going to say the same thing, I want to say it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to say the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me go, because this is really embarrassing, and I just have to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've dated a lot of women. I mean, not tons, but a lot. And, the thing is, I've never...been in love before. I've never even told anyone I love them before. Because I just never felt it. But from the day we met, from the first time our backs accidentally touched in the subway, I feel this, this... (he shakes his head) Maybe this is too much to say right now, but...I love you, Zoe. I really do. Stan finishes.    He looks at her and smiles.   Zoe just at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my mind, you were supposed to say, I love you, too. Instead, Zoe covers her mouth and runs to the bathroom. beat later, we hear her vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is at the sink, furiously brushing her teeth.    Stan enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe? He looks at her.   Sees the tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you crying? Everything's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I'm pretty sure it doesn't happen that fast. Zoe shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just found out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pregnant? As in you're going to have a baby? Zoe nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   It's hard to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who the father is. I kind of know him. I just don't know his name exactly. It was sort of anonymous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anonymous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a donor. From a sperm bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, what the fuck are you talking about? Sperm bank? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, this is so fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did all of this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day we met. That same day. And I didn't tell you because I didn't think there was any way I could be pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because supposedly with frozen sperm it takes a few tries and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, why would you do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I wanted a baby. And I'm almost forty, and I never met the right guy. I was afraid if I waited any longer it would all pass me by, and I'd miss my chance. Stan just looks at her.       Speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you. I would have never done it if--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told you I loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well....do you not now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say it like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   I'm pregnant.      I'm pregnant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you I'm in love with you and you tell me your pregnant with some stranger's child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say it like that.     You make it sound dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I...I'm stunned. I don't know what to say. What the fuck am I supposed to say?! This is great fucking news? Congratulations?! Why did you wait so long to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm freaking out, okay! I didn't know what to do. I made this big decision to do this and then I met you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what am I supposed to do now? This isn't how it was supposed to be. This isn't what--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, okay? Life isn't perfect. It's not all neat and tidy like your perfect family and your perfect farm and your bluegrass band. It's messy. It's fucked up. This is real life, okay? I'm sorry to break it to you. They both stand there.    After the raised voices, the si feels more pronounced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?   What's sorry going to do? Stan walks out. Zoe stands there.     And stands there. then she starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe lies in bed awake.    Nuts is beside her.    They are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's daybreak at the farm. FARM HANDS move herds of goats from one pasture to another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan lies awake in a small guest room.   Joan enters and startled to find him in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I thought you were in your room. Sorry. (then) Everything okay? Stan doesn't answer.   Joan sits on the corner of the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she seems really terrific. Dad and I both think so. She's smart and poised and... Next door, we hear Zoe puking again. Joan stops.   Then, wanting to seem open-minded, continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And warm and gracious... Another very LOUD HURL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pretty and... Another HURL.    Joan looks at Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear God. We hear the toilet FLUSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe sits in the passenger seat with the key in the igniti Stan leans against the car. They are both quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say. Neither does Stan, who says nothing.    He runs his foot and forth in the gravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'd given up on meeting someone like you, and I did what I thought was best. Stan still doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, for what it's worth...I love you, too. She puts the car in gear and pulls out.    Stan watches h His hands in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe stands in the hallway of Mona's apartment building. beat later, Mona opens the door and holds out her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here. Zoe walks slowly into her embrace. They stand like this f a long time. Just holding each other. Until Mona's three kids run out with wiffle-ball bats and chase each other d the hall. A beat later, the toddler runs after them cryin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe lies in bed with Nuts. She opens her eyes and stares the ceiling. Then, with a sigh, she gets up and does her morning ritual. She pulls up her nightgown and sticks out her stomach. the first time, we actually see a little bump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe lies on the table with a paper gown over her lap. She looks down at her feet in the stirrups. Sadly, we notice perfect pedicure. Dr. Harris comes in with a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations! What luck to get pregnant on the first try, huh? And with frozen sperm, too. So, how are we feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconvincing) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been hard. I don't know if I was really prepared for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your hormones aren't helping, and going through this without a partner must be difficult. Dr. Harries readies the ultrasound wand and inserts the device. He turns the monitor so that Zoe can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the good news is everything looks great. You are now eight weeks pregnant, which is an important milestone. With a little luck, we should be able to see a heartbeat today. On the screen we see a small flickering dot.    Dr. Harri smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?     That's...my baby? Saying these words out loud for the first time hits Zoe. Tears fill her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Baby. (then) Is it okay? Is it healthy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's just... (makes a face, then) Wait, a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Wait a minute, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I see another heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out) It has two hearts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...but you have two babies. Zoe's mouth falls open.

dialogues.speaker: NT. CAROL'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: We're back at Single Women By Choice. The women are sitti on the floor. Sara is still nursing Dakota. Zoe has her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twins!   That's fantastic! Zoe bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you crying?   That's so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.   That's me.   Lucky, lucky, me. The women are sensing the sarcasm, but not getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Is it a financial concern? There are many programs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm fairly loaded, actually. Used to work for Google. (blows nose) I'm sorry. This is hard for me. I don't know if I can talk about it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time. When you feel like sharing, we're here for you. We're all sisters here. (then, to the group) Let's give Zoe some space. When she's ready to talk, we're ready to listen. Deep, cleansing breaths, Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol takes a deep breath and then lets it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, in the meantime, does anyone else have anything they want to discuss? Problems? Concerns? Tabitha, the tall woman with the nose ring, raises her ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a hard time. Luca keeps asking why he doesn't have a daddy, and I just don't know what--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting out) There's this guy. His name is Stan. And he's fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
