dialogues.text: Uh...wasn't I just speaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you were with that guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe, this group is called Single Mother's By Choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   I'm sorry--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, excuse me. What about Luca? He's been really, really sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (floodgates opening) Have you ever met a guy and you get butterflies and you think this is the kind of man who could take care of me forever? The kind of guy who makes you re-examine everything? Like, maybe I can be a stay-at-home mom and be barefoot and pregnant. The women stare blankly at Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He actually lives on a farm! Plays the banjo! Maybe I could learn to sew and take care of the animals. Like Laura Ingalls. Even Dakota stops nursing and looks over at that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women file out. No one dares look at Zoe. It's very awkward, although Zoe seems unaware. She turns to Carol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol, thank you. This has been really helpful. Just getting it all out and being with other women who--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to ask you not to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we can help you, and, quite frankly, you're against everything we stand for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I thought we were all sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not you. (then) Do you know how long it took me to conceive? Five years. I had three miscarriages and spent every last dime on in-vitro. And Dana? The woman with the short hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one with the really short hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that doesn't really narrow it down much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She   just flew to Memphis to watch her   baby being born. Seconds after the   birth, the birth mother changed her   mind and refused to give it up. Zoe's face changes.     She starts to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, as you can see, we are really dedicated and choosing to be single mothers, and you seem to be in a slightly different place. You're carrying two healthy babies, and you have no idea how lucky you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you, Zoe. We all like you. But you kind of need to figure out where you are. Zoe nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Nana are walking the loop around the courtyard. Z looks terrible. Like she hasn't slept in days. They complete a lap. Arthur gives them the double thumbs up si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man is obsessed with my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   It's kind of upsetting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to take me on a cruise so that we can finally tie the knot. But, I don't know. What's the hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been engaged for nine years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason to rush into anything. Nana looks over at Zoe.     She sees the bags under her e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look terrible, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must really love him, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I'm sure he's wonderful, and I'm sure he loves you, too. But, you have put him in a really awkward position. Having a baby is a big adjustment for any couple. And you're not married. And he's not the father. And you've only been together a little while. And now you're having twins. And--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, if he actually wanted to stay with you right now, he'd be the greatest man in the world, and, quite frankly, I don't think any man is that great. They complete another lap around the courtyard.   Arthur smiles at them and then "raises the roof."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur's just about the best man I know, and look at him. He's a fucking idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan leans against the fence looking at the goats. He has the beginnings of a beard growing. The scruff makes him l older. Thinner. Joan approaches and stands next to him for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, people thought we were crazy when we bought this farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of our friends in New York, they thought we'd lost our minds. Stan nods.    We get the feeling he's heard this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'm saying that you may have envisioned your life going one way, but the reality is, it could go a totally different direction. You just have to be open to it. Stan watches a nearby goat coaxing her baby to nurse. shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a baby with someone I barely know, someone else's baby...it's just not how I pictured it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to work on Wall Street. Now I wear boots covered in goat shit. This isn't how I pictured it, either. But guess what...I'm happy. She gives him a sympathetic hug and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan lies in bed looking up at the "stars." There's even less glow now than last time. He sighs and then turns ove to try and sleep. ANGLE ON Nuts' off-road wheelchair in the corner of the r Stan looks at it and can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Nuts lie in the bed. They are looking at each oth on the pillow. Zoe scratches behind his ears. Zoe goes to the mirror and does her usual. The bump is growing. For the first time, we see a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Single Mother's By Choice women are sitting in their usual circle. Lori is passing around a list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you put your numbers down. I want to have everyone's number handy in case I go into labor early. Zoe enters.   All eyes turn.    She waves sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys. No one knows what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to apologize. I'm sorry I got into a relationship and wasn't honest with you guys, and I'm sorry I interrupted you, Tabitha. I hope Luca is doing better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carol) And I've thought a lot about what you said, about how lucky I am. I got into this whole situation because I wanted to have a baby. And, somehow, I lost sight of that. (then) Anyway, I need partners in this, and I hope you'll take me back. Lori smiles and hands her the piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a phone tree. I'm due next month, but my midwife thinks I may go sooner. I want everyone to be there. Are you in? Zoe smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe has her head held high and her cute belly pushed out far as it will go. A WOMAN with a double stroller approaches.   Zoe smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi./Hi. Zoe walks on. She sees her reflection in a store window a smiles. She looks like an actual pregnant person now. As she is walking and smiling to herself, we hear a familiar voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Her P.O.V. Stan appears next to her in the reflection. a brief second, they look like a family. Zoe turns. They both stop. Unsure of whether to hug or what. They just stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...look great. Zoe touches her belly.    Proud but protective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's awful isn't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie. (then) Did I tell you how pretty you look? Zoe nods.   Another silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you. A group of SCHOOL KIDS, lost in their own conversations, up the block, separating Zoe and Stan for a moment. This separation makes the moment all the more tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole time we've been apart, I've been trying to figure out what it is about you that I love so much. And I think that it's that a lot of people talk about doing things, but you actually do them. You're really kind of daring. How you quit your job and took over a pet store all because some asshole sold you a lame dog. You came and found me at the Farmer's Market even though the night before I acted like a total stalker... Zoe smiles at the memory.      Stan continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you're pregnant. Because you wanted to have a baby and didn't think you could wait any longer. Well, that's just the same kind of thing. It's...brave. And I can't love you for being that way but then walk away for the same reason. Stan takes her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. I've been waiting my whole life for you. And I can't let one little baby get in the way of that. I just...can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I need to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's big. And you're allowed to take all of this back when I tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just one baby....I'm having twins. Stan looks at her. Is she joking? Her look says no. He takes a beat. And then, even though it's not a joke, he starts to laugh. A little laugh at first and then a big o And then, Zoe starts laughing too.   The whole thing is j so ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late. Zoe and Stan are naked in bed, lying face to face. Stan puts his hand on her stomach. He feels the little bump, new since he's last been with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel any kicking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it feel like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like butterflies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan smiles. He likes this image. He runs his hand over h belly. Zoe moves in closer. Touches his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really sure you want to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     I'm really sure. They look at each other for a long time. Finally, Zoe clo her eyes and settles in for sleep, with Stan watching her she dozes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of a MONITOR where we see two distinct baby shapes floating head-to-toe. Dr. Harris holds the ultrasound wand to her belly. Stan doesn't say anything. He looks on in total amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're so...perfect.      They look like real babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to know the sexes? They look at each other.      Zoe smiles.   Stan shrugs. nods. Stan does, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.     Tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're having two healthy little girls. Stan gets tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan and Zoe walk down Madison Avenue. All of the other N YORKERS are on some kind of mission -- shopping, rushing meetings, or fighting for cabs. But Zoe and Stan just walk slowly hand-in-hand. Every so often looking at each other and just smiling or laughing. Then, suddenly, Stan picks her up in the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two girls! A WOMAN with a BABY in a Baby Bjorn passes by.   Stan smi Now he's part of this exclusive club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN past several small plates of food on a table.   A tells us what delectable items we are looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we have a yellowtail sashimi with ponzu sauce and pea shoots. This is carpaccio with shaved white truffles. And, finally, an heirloom tomato salad with fresh Buratta flown in from Italy this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Sam. It looks incredible. Sam tops off their champagne and exits.   Stan picks up h fork and starts eating. Zoe does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't eat any of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to each dish) Raw. Raw. Unpasteurized. (re: champagne) Alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get Sam back. He'll make you anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hurt his feelings. You go ahead. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what are you going to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CASHIER reads back Zoe's order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Mac, Quarter Pounder with cheese, four large fries, and a six piece chicken McNuggets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make that an eight, no, ten-piece McNuggets. (to Stan) You'll have some, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to the cashier) Ten-piece. Someone will eat them. Stan stands behind Zoe with an incredulous look on his fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Stan lie in bed, each reading a copy of "What to Expect when You're Expecting." Zoe has the McNuggets box on her chest. She dips each nug in three different sauces and then takes a bite. Stan watches with a mixture of amusement and revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: book) Have you gotten to page 79 yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I stopped reading when you ripped out one of my pages and used it as a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says here many women in the second trimester experience an increased sexual appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Zoe smiles and then slowly triple dunks another McNugget. She takes a seductive bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming on to me? It's kind of hard to tell right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I'm coming on to you. Zoe throws the McNuggets on the floor and climbs on top o him. She puts his hands on her body and then starts to ki him voraciously. After a beat, Stan stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have chicken in your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Mona are on the elliptical machines. Zoe is going very fast, while Mona is barely going at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you even working out? This is the one time in your life you're allowed to let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because look at me. I just keep getting bigger and bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah. That's kind of how it goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I'm going to scare him away. I'm like one of those giant bouncy castles. Soon I'm going to take over the whole back yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   He loves you for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just getting kind of freaked out by everything. He asked me to go to this wedding with him. What kind of first impression am I going to make on all of his friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're knocked up with some stranger's twins. So, already you're not exactly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anything to wear at least?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, dressed in a tux, sits on Zoe's bed.    He turns to closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay in there? A cocktail dress FLIES out and hits him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. He waits a few beats.   Another dress FLIES out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This SUCKS!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, whatever you wear is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have anything to wear! That's the problem. Another dress sails through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuuuuuuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always look great. I've never seen you not look great. Stan goes to the closet. Zoe is pulling on a long black dress. She tries to smush her boobs down into the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's perfect. You look hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?    You think? Zoe turns to reveal the back.     The two sides of the zi are ten inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a shawl or something? Zoe bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab pulls up in front of Zoe's brownstone. Stan opens t door for Zoe who is now wearing a long silver dress. Whil it's certainly hugging every curve and bump, it looks gre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look smokin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, honey. Zoe pauses in front of the open taxi door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.     We're super late. She tries to bend at the waist, but the dress is too tigh Then she tries to go in butt first and swing her legs aro but again, the dress is too tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you sort of go in...head first and then turn around. Zoe leans her head in and then has no other choice but to down sideways on the seat. Stan tries not to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and push me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it. Stan pushes her legs, and Zoe disappears inside the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe lies down straight across the seats like a board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate everyone. She sucks in her breath and tries to sit up. As soon as s bends at the waist, we hear a horrific RIP. She bursts in tears again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN over the coffee table. There's a pint of melty Ben and Jerry's, a roll of cookie dough (half eaten,) US Week and The National Enquirer. Zoe and Bobby lie on the floor looking at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he's telling everyone why I didn't go? I'm too much of a fat-ass walrus to go to the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a fat ass walrus. You're pregnant. Zoe eyes well up with tears again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you crying? So what?   You missed a stupid wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to have girls' night with me. This is way more fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm just so emotional lately. It's the hormones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't help it. Being pregnant sucks. You're emotional, and irrational, and you get back fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have back fat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm just kidding. (then) Okay, yes. You have back fat. Zoe feels her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Stan going to stay with me through this? I'm disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go shopping tomorrow. We'll get some hip maternity clothes... whatever that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pinching back fat) Look at me. What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the most amazingly wonderful person I know. Zoe smiles.   Tears come to her eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With back fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan leans against the bar with a beer in hand. He is watching all of the Farmer's Market girls and his co-work Fred, on the dance floor. Everyone looks drunk and happy. Olivia stumbles towards him with an empty glass of champa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you dancing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just about to go.    It's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, one dance. The spaghetti strap of her dress falls over her shoulder. Stan notices. She steps in closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For old time's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a girlfriend, Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never stopped you before. She tries to kiss him.    Stan steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's serious this time. Olivia pulls back, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is asleep in the bed. Her bump looks very cute under covers. Stan quietly gets ready for bed. She turns to him half asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Stan gets in bed next to her.   Zoe scoots into him.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I miss my old ass.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: It was one of my best features.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: You know what's weird?   I never knew your old ass.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: It's kind of like this ass but way hotter.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: I also don't know what you really like to eat and what's just a craving, or when you start laughing hysterically and then crying and you say, this isn't me, if that's true because I don't really know the real you. All I know is the pregnant you.

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: That is weird.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: Or like how you're horny all the time? Is that you? Or is that pregnant you?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: (lying) That's me.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: When all of this is over, who will you be?

dialogues.speaker: ZOE
dialogues.text: Hopefully, myself again.

dialogues.speaker: STAN
dialogues.text: But...who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock by the bed says 2:30 a.m. Stan is snoring slightly. Nuts is on the pillow beside him. Zoe's side is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe sits on the floor of the living room sifting through box of photographs. We FOLLOW her back into the bedroom and onto the bed. As Stan slowly opens his eyes, she holds up a photograph. His P.O.V.    It's a picture of a woman's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my old ass. Stan blinks a few times.      His eyes adjusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have a picture of your ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My college boyfriend took it. So, I guess in fairness, my ass doesn't look exactly like this anymore, but it's pretty close. It's held up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a nice ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you don't know the real me, so I thought I'd show you. She picks up another photograph. This one is of Zoe at twelve and at her most awkward -- short hair, braces and acne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me in seventh grade. Stan props himself up in one elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like Anthony Michael Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This period, as horrible as it was, made me who I am. I think every person should go through a hideously ugly phase. It builds character. (then) It also taught me that I should never, under any circumstances, have short hair and a perm again. She picks up another picture. It's Zoe in a bathing cap a Speedo. She's holding up a yellow ribbon and has her arm around Nana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This   is one of my favorites because look   how happy I am. I don't even know   what place yellow is, but I'm sure   it's not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifth place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I still look super happy, right? That's all because of Nana. Whatever I did, she thought it was the best. The next picture is a Halloween shot of Bobby, Mona and Z Bobby is all in green, Zoe is all in yellow and Mona is i regular clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are my best friends, Bobby and Mona. Mona and I met in high school and Bobby passed out on my couch in college and never left. You haven't met them yet because they might scare you away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you dressed like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halloween. We were supposed to be a traffic light but Mona bagged out at the last minute and so Bobby and I just look like idiots. That's typical Mona, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe puts the picture down and picks up another. It's a wo in a hospital bed. She's giving the thumbs up sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my mom. Stan takes the picture and studies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look just like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last picture of her that I have. She lived for a few more years, but we never took any pictures because she didn't want us to remember her like that. I was eight when she died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...can't imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had a great laugh. And really soft hands. She used to rub my back before I went to sleep. Zoe puts the picture on the bedside table, propping it up next to her clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any pictures of your dad? Zoe doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. If you don't want to talk about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother was in a coma for two years before the end. That's when my dad left her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...that's when he died.    To us, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Zoe.    I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) It's okay. It was an important lesson. That's when I realized that nothing lasts forever. This sad statement hangs in the air for a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, that's my story. That's the real me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things can last forever, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me they can't. Stan takes her hand, and they stay like that for a while. Just holding hands on the floor of her moonlit room. Finally, the silence is broken by the telephone RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Stan enter the lobby of an old building in Tribec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused. Why did you say you would come witness this birth in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Seemed like a good idea at the time. I was trying to get back in their good graces. Go home. I'll meet you there. I don't want them to see you anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's four in the morning. I'm not letting you walk home alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll just pop in, show my face and leave. Ten minutes, tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are candles everywhere and a table of food and drin Kind of like a birthing cocktail party. Zoe eats a browni Carol approaches with Lori, who is wearing a caftan and rubbing her large stomach. They all hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe, it's so nice of you to come, especially at this crazy hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really one of us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're in labor? You're so calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just wanted to come and say a quick hi and good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to stay. Lori wants us all to be together for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I really want to be here but...um, the truth is...actually I've been wanting to tell you guys for a while but, the truth is... Lori drops her head on Zoe's shoulder and lets out a gian MOAN. It's long and it's awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) She's having a contraction. Zoe nods.   This is weird.   Lori breathes through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   What was it you were saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm back with Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The farmer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, he makes cheese. He named a cheese after me. Isn't that romantic? Sort of? (off their blank stares) Well, anyway, I'm not technically a single mother by choice anymore. So, if you want me to leave right now, I totally understand. I'll just walk out the door and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I really want you to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bummed) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Zoe, if you're happy, we're happy. We'd love to meet him. Bring him to group any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually, he's downstairs, so I should probably get back to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.   Invite him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not shy. I've been through this before. It's quite beautiful, really. Zoe stands there trying to come up with another excuse. After a few moments, it's clear that she cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan looks up from the Hunan Lotus take-out menu he's bee reading to pass the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to come up. They begged me. And truthfully, I'm kind of scared of them. Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Stan hover over the dessert table. They both eat brownies and keep their eyes down. Sara is next to them nursing Dakota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good brownies, though. This one has peanut butter in it. Carol walks by with a little DRUM, which she bangs rhythmically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on everybody, it's time. She's getting into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's a water birth.   Didn't Zoe tell you? Carol starts banging the drum again and moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a water birth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But just so we're clear, this... (re. the whole scene) Is not the real me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait here. Zoe grabs another brownie and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of this very small, very cramped living roo an inflatable baby pool. And in this baby pool is Lori, w is now naked and pushing. Zoe watches, horrified, the brownie still in her hand. is beside her, playing the drum and chanting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-hi-ya-ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes wide) Wow. Wow. Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's amazing how the body can open up like that. Zoe covers her mouth. It looks like she is going to throw up. She stumbles for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just going to get some air. I'm feeling a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move, Zoe, you're my focal point. Lori then GRUNTS through another big contraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push, Lori. Push. While Lori's eyes are closed, Zoe tries to sneak out. chases after, still beating the drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave.   You're her focal point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't she use someone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in labor. You want to argue with her now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol beats the drum faster now. Some of the other Single Mothers by Choicers join her in the chant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-hi-ya-ya. Lori lets out a SCREAM as Tabitha and the MIDWIFE pull he legs back. Zoe watches with both hands over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus. (then) What is...that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sssshh. It's perfectly natural. Sometimes the bowels just let go. (then, back to chanting) Hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-ya-hi-ya-hi-ya-ya. The midwife fishes out the poop with a plastic bag.   Zoe turns away, gagging. She drops her brownie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Don't move, Zoe, I need you! You're my focal point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that even mean? Zoe turns back.   Her face white as a sheet.   Lori lets another WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to turn over.    Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Lori. We're here for you. We're all here for you. Carol beats the drum faster as Lori gets on all fours. Th midwife lifts Lori's leg up to the side.   Lori lets out loud, WHALE-LIKE MOAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Here comes the head. Lori's moan turns into a DONKEY-LIKE BRAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see the head, Lori.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's so much hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (woozy, afraid) I don't think that's the baby's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the head. Get me a mirror. It's in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it. Zoe makes a desperate attempt to run from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in the foyer, Stan is paralyzed.   Next to him is Dak who is crying. Through the hallway mirror, he can see what's going on in living room: a hefty woman on all fours in a dirty inflat swimming pool with a hairy head coming out of a hairy vag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, get the mirror!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan, walks backwards with his head down, holding a mirro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.     Hello. I'm Stan. Excuse me.     Hi. I'm Stan. Carol grabs the mirror and holds it under Lori. Lori lift her leg like a dog taking a piss and then starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all that wet, curly hair. Stan steals a look, starts to dry heave and rushes to Zoe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking out) Let's get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.   I'm her focal point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Suddenly, we hear a huge SCREAM. Zoe and Stan turn just in time to see the baby emerge and plop into the water. CU of the baby in the dirty water still attached to the umbilical cord. CU of Zoe and Stan's horrified faces. Zoe's eyes roll back and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER BLACK we hear silence. Blessed silence. No drums. No chants. No screams. Nothing. Until, we hear the SPLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are CLOSE on Zoe's face.    She opens her eyes.   Blin few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Why am I wet? WIDEN to reveal that Zoe is lying in the inflatable pool. Her eyes go from side to side. The horror of the situatio becoming clear. A spongy, purple thing floats by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (afraid) I think it's the placenta. Zoe's eyes roll back again and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 14th street is just coming to life as the FARMERS start t unload their wares. Zoe and Stan head up the street slowly, wearily, like soldiers back from battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. We really shouldn't have seen that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did mention that I barely know those people, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like forty times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel the need to say it again. They turn into the Farmer's Market. ANGLE ON Fred unloading cheese from the back of the Littl Goat truck. Stan and Zoe slowly walk towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't be like that for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for starters, you wax. ANGLE ON Olivia crossing from her berry stand to the chee stand with a blueberry pie. She is about to place the pie Stan's table when she looks up and sees Stan and Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (awkward beat, then) You remember Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, hi. And then Olivia notices Zoe's pregnant belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. (then, to Stan) Wow. At the same time, Zoe notices the post-it on the pie.   I says, SORRY ABOUT LAST NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing. Olivia crumples the post-it and turns to Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re. Zoe's pregnant belly) I had no idea it was that serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you it was serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) What the hell does, "sorry about last night" mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stupid. I was drunk and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was nothing? Olivia turns back to Stan, flabbergasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're having a baby? I didn't know you'd been together that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're not mine...but, yeah, we're having a baby. Two actually. On Zoe's look of shock we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fruits and vegetables and flowers become a blur as Zo runs out of the Farmer's Market. Stan chases after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me. Stan runs in front of her, forcing her to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said, "they're not mine."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I was flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flustered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm not exactly thinking straight. I've been up all night watching Orca give birth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) "They're not mine?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at a loss ) Well, I mean...technically, they're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minute he says this, he wishes he could take it back. Zoe just looks at him. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, all this time you're trying to figure out who the real me is, but who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe. She runs to a nearby cab and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe enters the apartment and slams the door behind her. S runs to the couch and collapses in tears. Nuts wheels ove and stands beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Mona are at their usual table.    Zoe looks like hasn't slept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think something happened with the berry girl?    They both said nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, are they going to come out and tell me? And that's not even the point. He said, the babies weren't his. And if he says that, he thinks that. And if he thinks that, he's not really committed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, now you run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I stick around for the end of the story when I know what it's going to be? Mona says nothing.   She looks like she might say somethi and then doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? If you want to say something, say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the end of the story? Can't you just give him the benefit of the doubt? He seems like such a good guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't even met him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and don't think I don't know the reason for that. You were never going to see this through, Zoe. Never. It was doomed before it began. Just like all of your relationships. You get out before you get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I'm hurt right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every man is not your father. When are you going to realize that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've known you for thirty years. I know you don't trust people. You and your grandmother, both. She's been engaged to Arthur for how long now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave Nana out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's never going to marry him. Just like you'd never marry Stan. No wonder you ended up with a sperm donor. He'll never let you down. It's your ideal boyfriend. Zoe's face changes.    She looks incredibly hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used a donor because I wanted a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     I went too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I wanted to have a family. Because Nana is the only one I've got and she's eighty-four years old. And then it will just be me. So, yeah, you went a little too far. Zoe leaves Mona at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Nuts lie on the pillow together.    Zoe scratches behind his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it's just you and me again. Nuts licks her face. She gets out of bed and goes to chec her belly in the mirror. It's actually getting kind of hu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe walks down the steps. Stan is waiting for her on the sidewalk. His hands in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Thursday. We have a doctor's appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no "we", Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I didn't mean to say it, and that's not how I feel. Zoe shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a mistake trusting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.     That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not good for me. You made me think I needed you, and I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it? Because of one stupid, asinine thing that I said, it's all over? This is how it ends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  This is how it ends. (then) I don't know why you're so surprised. I told you, nothing lasts forever. Zoe gives him a matter-of-fact shrug and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Harris moves the ultrasound wand over Zoe's belly. holds up her shirt and watches the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'll see you back in two weeks, and we'll start checking to see if the babies are dropping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to believe we're in the home stretch. Dr. Harris helps Zoe sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's the time I start discussing a birthing plan with my patients. Do you want me to wait until next time when Stan's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.    Uh, no. He won't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out of town or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    He's just...out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   I'm sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's back to just you and me now. We've come full circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't you want anyone with you in the delivery room? You know, like a birthing partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Nana are speed-walking.    Nana stops, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   `Cause you're all I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It will be a c-section, so, basically, just stand there and try not to faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Nana. It means a lot to me that you'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? I've been waiting my whole life for this. They pass Arthur, who is in his usual spot, but instead o leering at Nana, he's in his chair with his head back and eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been like that all morning.    I wore him out last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   I did not need to know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were celebrating. (with a smile) We finally set a date. Zoe stops dead in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nana walks Zoe through the Shadybrook dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we'll put the band here and the dance floor right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're getting married. What made you change your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of a sudden it just hit me, what am I waiting for? I love him. He loves me. What am I so afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   This is...really big news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't seem happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I am. It's just...it just makes my situation seem all the more tragic. You're getting married and here I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'm fine.    I'm really happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about you, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want you to make the same mistakes I made. I've been alone for over thirty years now, and that's too long. Sometimes in life you have to forgive and move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you talking about my father or Stan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe has her box of photographs.   She pulls out a picture the very bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if you don't learn how to forgive, you will always be stuck in the past. The photo is Zoe at age four and a man who looks so much her, that it can only be her father. After a long beat, she puts it on her bedside table, next the one of her mother. The two pictures, side-by-side mak up a family. Zoe and her father in one shot and her mothe from the hospital bed giving the thumbs up sign in the ot Over this image, we hear a quartet playing WEDDING MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music takes us into the church and there we find Nana lovely in her wedding gown, and Arthur, dashing in his morning suit, standing at the alter holding hands. Both h tears in their eyes. Arthur lifts her veil and gives her sweetest kiss. ANGLE ON Zoe and Bobby in the first pew, passing a handkerchief back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby leans against the piano singing a beautiful renditi of "What a Wonderful World." Nana and Arthur are alone on the dance floor.   It's thei first dance as husband and wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) I see trees of green, red roses too. I see them bloom for me and you... Zoe watches, her hands on her belly.   Mona stands beside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This song always makes me cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it happy or sad? The words are happy but the song is so sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's both.   Happy and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) I see skies of blue and clouds of white. The bright blessed day, the dark and sacred night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about the things I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really shitty of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was. Especially because you were right. Mona takes Zoe's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) And I think to myself...what a wonderful world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be alone forever, Mona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan stares off into space. His beard is back.   A CUSTOM surveys the different cheeses on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this new? The Zoe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is the first week it's been out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a sample?     What's it like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...very stubborn, overly suspicious and distrustful of men. The customer looks up at Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby pulls Zoe onto the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you old maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dance with me. One dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. But it doesn't mean that I won't dance with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Bobby starts dancing. But really dancing. Justin Timberla style. Zoe smiles at the absurdity and then tries to walk away. But Bobby won't let her escape. He blocks her path and keeps dancing. This time turning around and shaking h ass triple-time, like Beyonce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haaaaaay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away, you freak. A crowd of old people gather round. They start clapping, thinking this is some kind of young person's dance routin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smack it, Bitch. Bobby takes Zoe's hand and smacks his ass with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you love it. Uh-huh. That's right. Smack it. The old people do the same. Trying to learn the hip new dance the kids are doing. Several octogenarian couples smacking each other's asses. While this is happening, a weird look crosses Zoe's face. Bobby jumps up and turns around to face Zoe. But when he lands on the ground, his feet slide out from under him an hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? An OLD MAN in the crowd looks down at the puddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. Not again. (then, checks pants) Nope. Not me. A few other old people look down and check themselves. which point, Zoe looks down and realizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my water just broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole retirement community is outside throwing rice a Zoe, Bobby, Mona, Nana and Arthur try to figure out the logistics of the trip to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in labor.   You can't drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a car or a license. (then, to Bobby) You drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in Queens. I don't even know what side of the road they drive on here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will someone please just drive me to the fucking hospital? All of a sudden, a white ROLLS ROYCE pulls up.   Mona's a wheel. She leans out and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was my surprise for after the wedding, but let's hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This works. They all pile in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the car pulls off, revealing a sign that says, J MARRIED...FINALLY! "Ensure" cans tied to strings bump alo behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are a bit frantic in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Remember to breathe. Breathe in, breathe out, breathe in. Mona looks at Zoe in the rearview and does Lamaze breaths

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hee-hee, hoo-hoo, hee-hee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining in) Hoo-hoo. Hee-hee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo-hoo.   Hee-hee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop. It's getting really breathy in here. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me? I have amniotic fluid on my Gucci tux. ANGLE on the mini bar, which is fully stocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who needs a drink? Everyone (including Zoe) raises their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is being wheeled into Labor and Delivery with the gan tow. Bobby still has a glass of champagne in his hand. Na grabs the glass and swigs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Bobby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go in with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I certainly can't do it.   I don't do vaginas. They look at Arthur, who struggles to keep up with his walker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me. Nana starts to hyperventilate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nana, pull yourself together. This is the biggest moment of Zoe's life, and you can't let her down. I'd slap you right now, but I'm afraid your teeth would fly out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe is now alone in a room wearing a hospital gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hee-hee, hoo-hoo, hee-hee, hoo-hee. Bobby enters, all sweetness and light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, girl.     How ya doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (smiles, then) So, I really don't want you to worry, but Nana just passed out at the nurse's station and is now down in the ER getting stitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's under control. Good thing we're at the hospital, right? Zoe jumps out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back in bed. All is well. Arthur's with her. Now, on to bigger and better...who do you want to be your birthing partner? Your choices are me or Mona. Zoe starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. They're shitty choices. Do you want me to call your scary lesbian friends from your group?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get through this, okay? You just have to really think about it. Who do you want with you in the delivery room? Zoe wipes her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is the one person you want by your side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe runs down the street with a blanket over her hospital gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe jumps in.   The cabbie looks at her in the rearview m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not an escaped mental patient, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe runs across 14th street. The blanket flaps behind her like a cape. She looks like a hugely pregnant super-hero. And suddenly, she has to slow down and then stop complete for a contraction. She leans against a parked van to stea herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.   Son of a bitch, that hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Out of the corner of her eye, Zoe sees an enormous strawb on the side of the van. And then next to it, she sees Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in labor? As soon as the contraction ends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off. Zoe takes off again.    Olivia watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe runs through the market looking for Stan. ANGLE ON Stan's truck, where Stan and Fred are unloading cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan! Fred turns around and sees Zoe running. All belly and boo bouncing towards him. Her gown starting falling off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. I've had nightmares that started like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan! Stan turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Don't run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it! She keeps running towards him. He now runs towards her. They finally meet. Zoe is out of breath and can barely ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panting) Great. I'm great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you in a hospital gown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in labor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nana's my birthing partner, but she passed out and needed stitches, and Bobby asked me who I most wanted with me, and...it's you. It's only you. (then) I don't want to be alone anymore. I love you. You don't know how much I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan doesn't know what to say.   He's literally speechles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than anything in the world, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been in love with you since the moment you stole my cab. Zoe bends over, holding her stomach.   A contraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hee-hee, hoo-hoo, it was my cab, hee-hee, hoo-hoo. The contraction ends. Zoe can finally smile again.      S laughs and throws his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.   Ow.   Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Oh, I'm sorry. I just love you. I love you so much. (then) Let's get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think I really need to go to the hospital now. They kiss again. And then pull apart and look at each oth Stan has tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go have our babies. People clap and cheer as they hurry out of the Farmer's Market. Even Olivia, watching from a distance, can't help but applaud the big moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some fantastic song that makes us want to cry is playing. We are CLOSE on Zoe's face. She is smiling.    She does n look scared. And she does not look alone. WIDEN to reveal Stan by her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we PULL BACK and above the operating table and see Dr Harris performing the C-section. He pulls out the babies by one. We FOLLOW the babies as they get swaddled tight and hande back to Zoe and Stan. Zoe and Stan look at the little girls and then at each ot They are both in tears. Even Dr. Harris can't help but cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's night.   Zoe is asleep. She opens her eyes and takes a moment to figure out where is. She turns to the side and finds Stan sleeping next to her, curled up against her in the tiny hospital bed. To the side of the bed are two bassinets.   Each baby sle soundly in a little pink hat. And in the next bed is Nana, asleep with a bandage on her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuts trots/rolls down the sidewalk wearing a sweater that says, "I'M A BIG BROTHER." We TILT up and see Zoe and Stan strolling arm in arm, eac with a Baby Bjorn with a rosy-cheeked baby girl in it. Bo girls have flaming red hair. A woman pushing a stroller passes by.   She smiles at Zoe Stan. They smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are now at the counter with hot dogs in front of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knew you were such a romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's the anniversary of our first date. Where else would I take you? (then) Cheers. They clink dogs and each take a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a year, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible. Wouldn't change a thing. Well, except for the part where you dumped me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the part where you dumped me. (to the babies) Girls...Mommy and Daddy were stupid. The babies smile and coo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baby-talk) Yes, we were. Yes, we were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time we held hands was in here. It started out as a high- five, but then I strategically turned into a hand-hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both agreed that we were totally sick of weddings and hated when people wrote their own vows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...I hope you won't hold it against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nana and Arthur come through the door smiling.    Zoe loo them, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? And then Bobby comes through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby? And then Mona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? And Joan and Edward. And Jalisa. And Fred. And Carol, Lor and Sara with Dakota planted on her breast. And a priest. And we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoe and Stan, still wearing the Baby Bjorns, stand face t face in front of the guests and the priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise to love you even though you still eat chicken McNuggets in bed. I promise to name cheeses after all of our children no matter how embarrassed they are by it. I promise to always check out your ass when you walk away, and I promise to love you more tomorrow than I do today, which doesn't even seem impossible... And slowly, the sound of Stan's voice fades out and the s of Louis Armstrong's voice fades in... And we watch Zoe's face as she realizes that there are so things that really will last forever.
